data.title: The Long Ryders + Morton Valence
data.meta_description: The Long Ryders are trailblazers who pioneered the alt-country sound in 1980's Los Angeles. Comprising Sid Griffin, Stephen McCarthy, Tom Stevens, and Greg Sowders, the band seamlessly blend folk, rock, and country influences, creating a distinctive jangle-pop sound. Their albums Native Sons and State of Our Union in the mid-80s showcased their prowess in songwriting and marked them as leaders in the roots rock movement. Despite commercial under-appreciation during their initial run, The Long Ryders’ impact on the alt-music scene was profound, influencing subsequent generations exploring the intersection of genres. Their enduring legacy as pioneers who bridged traditional Americana with alternative sounds continues to resonate, solidifying their place in the evolution of diverse American music landscapes. For this special show, The Long Ryders will be performing their classic album Native Sons in full, celebrating 40 years since its initial release. Please note, seating will be at the front, with standing space behind. Morton Valence support.  "Grittily romantic slices of English life" 5/5 NARC “Just about the most intriguing band on these shores” **** The Guardian UK “There is no one operating across quite the same terrain as they do” 8/10 Classic Rock

It does not store any personal data._ga2 yearsThe _ga cookie, installed by Google Analytics, calculates visitor, session and campaign data and also keeps track of site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognize unique visitors._gat_gtag_UA_41180835_11 minuteSet by Google to distinguish users._gid1 dayInstalled by Google Analytics, _gid cookie stores information on how visitors use a website, while also creating an analytics report of the website's performance. Some of the data that are collected include the number of visitors, their source, and the pages they visit anonymously._hjAbsoluteSessionInProgress30 minutesHotjar sets this cookie to detect the first pageview session of a user. This is a True/False flag set by the cookie._hjFirstSeen30 minutesHotjar sets this cookie to identify a new user’s first session. It stores a true/false value, indicating whether it was the first time Hotjar saw this user._hjIncludedInPageviewSample2 minutesHotjar sets this cookie to know whether a user is included in the data sampling defined by the site's pageview limit._hjIncludedInSessionSample2 minutesHotjar sets this cookie to know whether a user is included in the data sampling defined by the site's daily session limit.CONSENT2 yearsYouTube sets this cookie via embedded youtube-videos and registers anonymous statistical data.
